documents.document: Many of the groups across the country are working to support people who are affected by the new Christmas restrictions, with everything to food hampers to checking in on people experiencing isolation. Find your group here: https://t.co/LSPWBe7ttH #lockdown #Christmas
RT @DrRosena: This announcement today will have created anxiety and stress for many. Don't be afraid to reach out for help if you are worri

We've been quiet as groups have been getting on with supporting their communities Anyone feeling nervous about lockdown, or who has capacity to support their area, find your nearest group https://t.co/LSPWBe7ttH Remember - the best organising happens on small and local scales
Took them 1 hour to find and question us. Took them 1 month to find and question Dominic Cummings. #peoplevspoliticians #themvsus #bodiesdontlie https://t.co/czvhJrxMng

RETWEET AND SHARE w/ hashtag #BodiesDontLie @jeremycorbyn @OwenJones84 @afuahirsch @GeorgeThePoet @Lowkey0nline @JohnBoyega @AyoCaesar @felixwhite @DawnHFoster @DawnButlerBrent @HackneyAbbott @DavidLammy @BellRibeiroAddy @jonsnowC4 https://t.co/vviBVYSFzK
RT @CovidAidUK: Outside Dominic Cummings House now. #NoJusticeNoPeace #BlackLivesMatter https://t.co/qn9WPBm72z
Covid 19 BAME report late and incomplete. @PHE_uk publish full findings NOW! #bodiesdontlie https://t.co/vc17Pak7F7
It's coming up to 7pm. Please take your support to your doorsteps and blast out Jimmy Cliff's 'The Harder They Come' in solidarity with #BlackLivesMatter #SolidarityForever https://t.co/ZOCbZT0uaj
Amged el-Hawrani, Adel el-Tayr and Habib Zaidi were the first three doctors to die of Covid-19. The govt have repeatedly put BAME lives in danger #justiceforBellyMujinga #WontWorkToDeath
Mutual Aid activists stage die-in outside Cummings house, after govt failure to protect BME lives. #CovidDOESdiscriminate RETWEET
Racism is the riskiest pre-existing condition. BAME people UP TO 50% MORE LIKELY TO DIE FROM COVID-19 #BODIESDONTLIE https://t.co/DzNHFy7xz2
Hancock says 'black lives matter' whilst risking the lives of BAME key workers and NHS staff #justiceforBellyMujinga #NoJusticeNoPeace #BlackLivesMatter https://t.co/fsopeXqAEq
Outside Dominic Cummings House now. #NoJusticeNoPeace #BlackLivesMatter https://t.co/qn9WPBm72z
ACTIVISTS STAGE DIE IN OUTSIDE CUMMINGS HOUSE AS UK RACISM LEADS TO THOUSANDS OF COVID DEATHS. #BODIESDONTLIE BUT THE GOVT DOES #BlackLivesMatter https://t.co/Zdm04u43dQ

If you can't/don't want to go out on the streets in a pandemic, here are other ways you can support the #BlackLivesMatter movement from your home. Written by @MelzDot for @galdemzine https://t.co/VDcAPaZUDW

We've seen some discussion in mutual aid groups about whether to attend #BlackLivesMatter protests in the UK. If you decide to show your support in that way, check out this thread first. https://t.co/l2N3xooVfB
Local solidarity is great - it's even better when it's paired with global solidarity! Sign this if you can https://t.co/Ns7vjDoUkw
Practical advise for socialising under new gov guidance. We recommend still avoiding non essential contact to save as many lives as possible. https://t.co/48MO94l1xR
RT @NEON_UK: These Mutual Aid groups exemplify some of the best ways that communities have been facing the pandemic and Cummings represents
RT @DocsNotCops: The governments decision to scrap the immigration health surcharge for NHS care workers must be extended to EVERYONE.

2/2 Gvmnt response to the pandemic has never been good enough and it is ordinary people who have stepped up to do the work they have failed to. We must continue to do so now, by staying home and saving lives. No matter how desperately unfair that feels #covid19

1/2 Despite what gvmnt said yesterday, unnecessary travel could still be deadly Many of us are feelings frustrated, we have lost or are losing loved ones and might feel that if the rules no longer apply to one person, why should they continue to apply to us? BUT
And a reminder that the wonderful @Fran_Face developed this list of resources for #disabled people navigating #covid https://t.co/DSEMSkB0jC

Lockdown and social distancing have disrupted all of our lives but people will disabilities are bearing more of the weight. Please read this article to better understand how to support people with disabilities in our communities. #Covid19 https://t.co/RcxuBXx24q

Short term support for communities during a pandemic means nothing without fighting for their rights and protection in the long run. Read this blog by @minnierahman at @JCWI_UK to see how the #ImmigrationBill would affect key workers currently saving our lives. #Covid19 https://t.co/g62fU5K9cN

Everyone has the right to safe warm accommodation - especially during a pandemic Gvmt are starting to cut funding to shelter homeless people. Please push back against this by speaking to your MPs and councils give extra support to services in your area https://t.co/osrGDZevnA

@ben_rog Hi Ben, there are currently 4253 groups, though often these groups have split down into additional smaller groups to best serve smaller pockets of their neighbourhood. For example, Lewisham is one of the 4253 groups but has split down into 20+ more groups of more local organising

For anyone else who is a victim or survivor of domestic abuse, support is available in many places including from https://t.co/60a8ercyIY More details of services can be found here https://t.co/xOOHKrrAEi

Incidents of domestic abuse, including deaths, have been rising under lockdown. Yesterday was #IDAHOBIT2020 for anyone currently experiencing domestic abuse relating to their sexuality or gender, reach out to @GalopUK https://t.co/ufl5ZfNQ7U
RT @NCLMutualAid: The community larders set up by #elswick #arthurshill #MutualAid groups have had a makeover! Thanks to @bt_uk for letti

Today there are planned mass gatherings to protest the lockdown. Organisers have direct links to far right groups We recommend avoiding these spaces continuing with lockdown but also take care of those in your community who might be targeted by these groups #COVID19

Stressed about rent but also wondering whether a rent suspension is feasible, check this from @joebeswick1 at @NEF then sign up with @LDNRentersUnion For those of you outside of London you can check the #CantPayWontPay campaign for advice and sign up with @ACORN_tweets https://t.co/XcIkHjccsU
Great article on some of the radical history of Mutual Aid. Mutual Aid in the Time of Coronavirus: Southern Solidarity More https://t.co/BJwugX3iHv
RT @goosefat101: #ff some orgs doing important activism/education: @EDeportations @ukdecrimnow @BARACUK @lgsmigrants @TransActualUK @Gender

If you, or people in your community, are having to chose between buying food and basic essentials or paying your rent, check out this new campaign from @LDNRentersUnion #Covid19 #cantpaywontpay https://t.co/k0QWI9XF2Z
RT @CheerfulPodcast: "Tens of thousands of people have joined community efforts to look after the most vulnerable in society." @guardian
Hi everyone, one last day to fill in this survey so we can start implementing support. Please take a moment to note down your thoughts if you haven't already: https://t.co/GncIuIOjgB
RT @CovidAidUK: Dear local volunteers, We'd like to know more about the issues you're facing in supporting different members of your commu

For some workers, legal restrictions might make joining a union or quoting section 44 impossible Long term we need decriminalisation - short term we want to share ways to support with the Mutual Aid network Pls link to advice below @UVWunion @lawrsuk @UVWunion etc
RT @CovidAidUK: For those of you expected to return to work this morning : - Section 44 of the Employment Rights Act gives you the right t

Those who are salaried - if you have some spare income, share this on social, by text and over the phone with workers who might be expected to return to work to unsafe conditions. #JoinAUnion #MutualAid #Covid19UK https://t.co/wWmQIuRBSt

For those of you expected to return to work this morning : - Section 44 of the Employment Rights Act gives you the right to walk away from any unsafe work - Join a union #JoinAUnion #COVID19 #Lockdown

Government advice is confusing at best, deadly at worst. We encourage you to listen to doctors and carry on as usual with your mutual aid projects, social distancing and lockdown. #lockdownuk #COVID19 https://t.co/Z4QWzd7nyr
RT @seanbaillie9: 3 steps of your asked to return to work: - Join a Union - Dont work without an updated risk assessment - collectively s
RT @exiledwolf: For my UK-based followers worried they might be forced back to work, as a health and safety worker, let me present to you w
Reminder to fill this in with your morning cuppa! https://t.co/HBTBiU1q1E

Dear local volunteers, We'd like to know more about the issues you're facing in supporting different members of your communities. If you've got a moment to fill out this short survey, it won't take longer than a quick brew. Please share: https://t.co/3YCirJpAm0

RT @NadiaWhittomeMP: If you're a care worker who has faced pressure, threats or disciplinary action for speaking out about PPE, contact my
RT @SloughMutualAid: A HUGE thanks to all involved in making these banners for English, Punjabi, Polish Urdu speaking folks in #Slough
RT @GrayInGlasgow: After this all ends. Edinburgh window sign. https://t.co/JHsud1S4P6
Can you help support mutual aid for 50 Palestinian families (400 people) on lockdown in the Jordan Valley? https://t.co/PYHFS7eO1r
RT @lgsmigrants: SLRA and organisations like them are continuing to help those in need during the CoVid crisis. But they need your support,

Please share: The Effect of COVID-19 on the LGBTQ+ Asylum Seekers. Help service providers Govt to understand the impact of Pandemic on LGBTIQ+ Asylum Seekers in the UK. STRICTLY anonymous, confidential and voluntary. https://t.co/TQhJmgwlJf
RT @lgsmigrants: 'It was bad, but now its been unbearable': The children going hungry during the pandemic Children are being excluded fr
RT @SistersUncut: We must ensure no one is left behind; and this is only possible through accessibility, interdependence, collective action
RT @conniebliff: Yesterday an elderly woman in my block taped the first note to the lobby door, so my neighbours and I dropped off some boo
RT @NLSistersUncut: Weve created infographics to share about mutual aid, the consequences of the COVID-19 bill how we can support each o
RT @NEON_UK: We're very lucky to have @saiogradin guiding us through a 'history of mutual' aid right now as part of our webinar series. S
RT @lawrsuk: Very pleased to have collaborated on this piece highlighting the unequal impact of COVID-19 the lack of access to support th
@virginmedia Alternatively can you confirm if you did indeed block it at your end?
@virginmedia Lots of us can use it fine, but also lots of people reporting trouble. It looks like at some point you blocked it - are you able to reverse that please?
RT @JCWI_UK: Coronavirus is a threat to all of us. In the fight against it, no-one should be left behind. Check out our guide to supportin

We have had complaints from some users who cannot access our groups map page. It looks like it has been flagged as a false positive here https://t.co/ORa1vSmOTR - we are *trying* to contact @virginmedia to try and get this fixed

3/3 Mutual Aid groups are continuing to provide a lifeline for their local communities and stepping in to provide the support where the government has failed. Our full statement here: https://t.co/xiHlSHTX5C #Coronavirus #COVID19

2/3 This unlawful arrest adds to a growing concern that police do not fully understand their new powers and are repeatedly misusing or abusing them, and growing concern that the police are utilising their increased powers to disproportionately harass Black and Brown people.

1/3 We are deeply disappointed to hear about an incident in Fallowfield, Manchester, in which a black man was arrested and threatened with pepper spray whilst running errands for his loved ones. https://t.co/gT3jTs3uwD
RT @CovidAidSlough: What is mutual aid? Last week we saw a homeless man across the street crossed over to ask if he needed anything. He
RT @Dis_PPL_Protest: Opportunities 2 tell MP committees how the coronavirus pandemic is affecting disabled people - few different parliamen
Our heath is only as safe as our communitys #LeaveNoOneBehind https://t.co/qWFXXjxfQm
Who better than neighbours to do the job quickly? @KelseyMxMo https://t.co/bq13smOGD5
RT @zarahsultana: Black and Asian people are being disproportionately hit by Coronavirus, reflecting wider economic and social inequalities
RT @JCWI_UK: Coronavirus is a threat to us all. In the fight against it, no one can be left behind. Check out our guide to supporting migr

Some really exciting webinars coming up from @NEON_UK and members of the mutual aid network. Learn about how to reach and protect more people with your organising, the history of mutual aid and experiences on the ground. #coronavirusuk #CovidSolidarity https://t.co/rkDaooPwaC

RT @CovidAidSlough: 28/28 No-one will be left behind. https://t.co/aGeE9G22gQ
RT @CovidAidSlough: 19/28 Mutual aid affirms that we're all we've got, we're all we need. https://t.co/lWUvqs45hr
RT @CovidAidSlough: An Introduction to Mutual Aid - (1/28) We hope this can be of use Special thanks to @deanspade Ciro Carrillo. Che

Check out our new look website! It's packed full of resources and support for local mutual aid groups. The site also features a map and searchable directory of the thousands of groups that have sprung up across the UK. https://t.co/gFwt0wlEcz
RT @artofactivism: Through the #covidmutualaid whatsapp group set up at the start of the lockdown, children on my parents' street have star
@HandleBards Well share with the London groups! Thank you for doing this.
RT @CovidAidSlough: We've made a visual introduction to the mutual aid model. We hope it can be of use With special thanks to @deanspa
For more resources on supporting migrants during #Covid_19 you can check out this doc from @migrantsorg and others #LeaveNoOneBehind https://t.co/2NxZfCaFz7
People around the UK are showing solidarity with those in detention. During a pandemic were only as safe as everyone else. #LeaveNoOneBehind https://t.co/NevoncAuia
@PeeWiiii There are links on each group - usually to a FB group or a WhatsApp. If you cant use those platforms get in touch with us and well try and connect you
@mulberrybush Hi Diana, you should be able to search the website by postcode. Groups listed are often covering larger regions but if you join your nearest one they can connect you to your subgroup!
@addmy2cents Hi Trevor, can you email us using the contact on https://t.co/AxbcItALyU please? Or we recommend trying the next nearest group as a back up
@walltowallart Theres a registration form on https://t.co/AxbcItALyU
Wake up. Feel terrified. See more groups on this. Feel better. #CovidSolidarity #CoronaLockdown https://t.co/PEGZoyrE4Z
@DebWhatford Hey there. Sorry to hear youre struggling. You can try and get in touch with your local mutual aid group here: https://t.co/OWpZyfFCQV
@AnitaBellows12 @Dis_PPL_Protest @Heretoanywhere Have you tried this group? https://t.co/9Y08nrkL3J
RT @SumRogM8: So so happy I managed to get this on video, so unbelievable The sound of people across Portsmouth cheering for our amazing
RT @NHSEnglandLDN: Thank you London #ClapForCarers #ClapForNHS

Domestic violence is likely to spike during the #lockdown If youre concerned about yourself or someone else, weve listed resources here from @NHSuk @womensaid and @ChaynHQ #DomesticAbuse #Coronavirus https://t.co/UtcfOyCFW2 https://t.co/9EHpfpFjf2

People don't need saving, they need community @Aviah_Sarah_Day and @AnnaVickerstaff spoke to @VICEChangeInc on the principles of mutual aid, local organising in the face of coronavirus, and the importance of #covidsolidarity https://t.co/Ab7MVu1ZdW
@mickhumph Sorry wrong link: https://t.co/LSPWBe7ttH
@mickhumph Hi Mick - where are you based? If you look up your local mutual aid group at https://t.co/gyDms3FsnZ someone should be able to help you
RT @streetskitchen: we need twitter magic! NEED to magically find lots of #environmentfriendly bento boxes cutlery URGENTLY so we can c

Millions of you created 3400 mutual aid groups across the UK thousands more have signed up as #NHSResponders We think independent community support is still a vital lifeline for people in the face of coronavirus. Our thoughts here: https://t.co/gWX9QyIOJY #CovidSolidarity
